Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes based on electronically conducting ceramics have potential advantages over conventional Ni-YSZ anodes, including better fuel flexibility, stability under redox cycling, and sulfur tolerance.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Here we report on anodes based on La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.98V0.02O3 that also contained Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 (GDC) and a small amount (5 wt.%) of NiO, and describe results for these electrodes in SOFCs with GDC electrolytes.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Microstructural evaluation showed the desired porous microstructure.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Metallic Ni, if present in the anodes after reduction, was below the X-ray diffraction detection limit; the Ni may instead have dissolved in the perovskite phase.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Cell performance with hydrogen was evaluated using current-voltage measurements and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy-anode polarization resistance values were generally larger than typically reported for Ni-YSZ anodes under comparable test conditions.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The SOFCs were found to operate well with slightly humidified hydrocarbon fuels including methane, ethane, propane, and butane, but showed slight degradation over several hours apparently due to coking.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: However, initial cell performance was recovered by switching to H-2 fuel or by exposing the anodes to air.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Cell performance was stable during several hydrogen-air and propane-air reduction-oxidation cycles.
Titulo: Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes
Effect of fuel composition on the performance of ceramic-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes
